verses.text: 後來，摩西和亞倫去對法老說：「耶和華以色列的 神這樣說：讓我的人民離開這裡，叫他們可以在曠野向我守節。」

words.note: The personal name of God in the Old Testament.
Refers to the singular God of Israel, often capitalized in Bibles.
Refers to celebrating religious festivals commanded by God.

verses.text: 法老回答：「耶和華是誰，我要聽他的話，讓以色列人離開呢？我不認識耶和華，也不讓以色列人離開。」

words.note: Compound for 'people of Israel'.

verses.text: 他們說：「希伯來人的 神遇見了我們；求你讓我們走三天的路程到曠野去，獻祭給耶和華我們的 神，免得他用瘟疫或刀劍擊殺我們。」

words.note: Compound for 'Hebrew people'.
Refers to the singular God of Israel, often capitalized in Bibles.
Refers to the singular God of Israel, often capitalized in Bibles.

verses.text: 埃及王對他們說：「摩西、亞倫哪，你們為甚麼使人民懶惰不作工呢？去挑你們的擔子吧。」

words.note: Used to address someone or add emphasis.
Indicates suggestion or command.

verses.text: 法老又說：「你看，現在這地的民很多，你們竟叫他們歇下擔子？」

words.note: Conveys surprise or unexpectedness.

verses.text: 就在那天，法老吩咐眾民的督工和首領說：

words.note: Commonly found in biblical narratives about forced labor.

verses.text: 「你們不要像往日一樣再把草給人民做磚，叫他們自己去撿草。
他們往日做磚的數量，你們還是向他們要，一點也不可減少，因為他們是懶惰的，所以他們才呼喊說：『讓我們去獻祭給我們的 神。』

words.note: The preceding character '　' is a revered space in Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 你們要把更重的工作加在這些人的身上，好使他們專心作工，不聽謊言。」
眾民的督工和首領出來，告訴人民說：「法老這樣說：『我不再給你們草。

words.note: Commonly found in biblical narratives about forced labor.

verses.text: 你們自己能在哪裡找到草，就到哪裡去撿吧，但你們的工作一點也不可減少。』」

words.note: Verb + complement indicating successful completion.
Indicates direction of action away from speaker.
Often used with 不 to mean 'not at all'.
More formal/stronger than simply '不要'.

verses.text: 於是，人民就分散到埃及全地，去拾禾秸作草。

words.note: Indicates a sequence of events or cause and effect.

words.definition: whole land, all over the land

words.note: Indicates purpose of going.
More formal than '撿'.
Refers specifically to grain stalks after harvest, used as straw.

verses.text: 督工們催著說：「你們的工作，每天的本分，要在當天完成，像以前有草的時候一樣。」

words.note: 著 indicates continuous or sustained action.
Literally 'original share' or 'inherent duty'.

verses.text: 法老的督工責打他們派定的以色列人的首領，說：「你們昨天今天為甚麼沒有做完指定要你們做的磚，像往日一樣呢？」

words.note: More formal and stronger than '打'.
Verb + complement indicating completion.
A more formal or literary way to say '以前'.

verses.text: 以色列人的首領就來，向法老呼求說：「你為甚麼這樣待你的僕人呢？

words.note: Often used in religious contexts for earnest prayer or petition.
Common in biblical and historical contexts for a subordinate.

verses.text: 沒有草給你的僕人，但他們對我們說：『你們做磚吧！』看哪，你的僕人受了責打，其實這是你自己人民的錯。」

words.note: Common in biblical context, less so in modern daily use.
Indicates suggestion, request, or mild command.
Often used to introduce something important or surprising in biblical texts.
A formal term for physical punishment.

verses.text: 法老說：「你們確實是懶惰的，所以你們才說：『讓我們去獻祭給耶和華。』

words.note: Links an adjective to what it describes, or nominalizes it.

breakdown.m: by means of, in order to

words.note: Indicates a consequence or condition.
The Hebrew name for God.

verses.text: 現在你們去作工吧；草是不給你們的，磚卻要如數交上。」

words.note: Forms a noun phrase from a verb phrase, 'that which is not given to you'.
Means 'as per the number' or 'the full quota'.

verses.text: 以色列人的首領因有命令說：「你們每天本分要做的磚數不可減少」，就知道自己有禍了。

words.note: Forms an adjectival clause 'the bricks you must make'.
A common biblical expression meaning to experience misfortune.
Indicates a change of state or completion of an action.

verses.text: 他們從法老那裡出來的時候，遇見摩西和亞倫，正在站著等候他們，

words.note: Refers to the Israelite leaders from the previous verse.
Links the preceding clause to form a temporal phrase 'when...'.
Indicates an action is happening at the moment of reference.
Refers to the Israelite leaders.

verses.text: 就對他們說：「願耶和華鑒察你們，審判你們，因為你們使我們的香氣在法老眼前和他的臣僕眼前都發臭了，把刀放在他們的手裡來殺我們。」

words.note: Refers to divine scrutiny.
Refers to a pleasant smell, often associated with offerings.
Refers to those serving a ruler.
Indicates purpose or result of the preceding action.

verses.text: 摩西回到耶和華那裡，說：「主啊！你為甚麼苦待這人民呢？為甚麼差派我呢？

words.note: A title for God or master.

verses.heading: The Assurance of Deliverance

verses.text: 自從我到法老那裡，奉你的名說話以來，他就苦待這人民，你一點也沒有拯救你自己的人民。」

words.definition: by order of, in the name of
words.note: Often used in religious contexts, e.g., 奉主的名 (in the name of the Lord).
Used with a time point to mean 'ever since'.
Often used with 也 + negative, meaning 'not at all'.
Here, emphasizes the negative: 'not even a little'.
